de.ralleytn.simple.input

Class XIGamepadEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ralleytn.simple.input.DeviceEvent
      • de.ralleytn.simple.input.GamepadEvent
        • de.ralleytn.simple.input.XIGamepadEvent

  • public class XIGamepadEvent
extends GamepadEvent
    Represents an event that was fired by a gamepad that uses the XInput API.
    Since:
    1.1.0
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

    • Constructor Detail

      • XIGamepadEvent

        public XIGamepadEvent(Device device,
                      Direction direction,
                      int analogStick,
                      int button,
                      float intensity,
                      int trigger)
        Parameters:
        device - the device that fired this event
        direction - the direction the POV or an analog stick is facing
        analogStick - the analog stick associated with this event
        button - the button that was either pressed or released
        intensity - the intensity with which an analog stick or trigger is pushed
        trigger - the trigger that is being used
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • XIGamepadEvent

        public XIGamepadEvent(Device device,
                      int button,
                      boolean press)
        Constructor for GamepadListener.onButtonPress(GamepadEvent) and GamepadListener.onButtonRelease(GamepadEvent)
        Parameters:
        device - the device that fired this event
        button - the button associated with this event
        press - pressed = true, released = true
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • XIGamepadEvent

        public XIGamepadEvent(Device device,
                      int trigger,
                      float intensity)
        Constructor for XIGamepadListener.onTriggerPush(XIGamepadEvent).
        Parameters:
        device - the device that fired this event
        trigger - the trigger that was pushed
        intensity - the intensity of the trigger push
        Since:
        1.1.0

        public final int getTrigger()
        Returns:
